urls.resource_name: OSF project (original tightness × efficiency COVID analysis)
urls.why_needed: Contains the authors’ analysis scripts and materials to reproduce growth-rate extraction and cross-national regressions.

urls.resource_name: OSF project for Lancet Planetary Health tightness–COVID study
urls.why_needed: Provides public code/materials used by the authors’ team for cross-national COVID analyses following the paper’s design.
Supplies the expanded cultural tightness–looseness scores used to extend Gelfand’s measure to 57 countries for replication.
Source for Government Effectiveness (aka government efficiency) indicator; use 2017 or updated years for the efficiency covariate.
Stable download/metadata entry to obtain the Government Effectiveness series for all countries.

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data COVID-19 (historical repo, stable URLs)
urls.why_needed: Global country-day COVID cases and deaths (per million available) to compute infection growth rates for a new replication period.
Current distribution point for OWID’s COVID dataset with CSV endpoints and variable documentation for replication.
Direct CSV for daily country metrics (cases/deaths per million) to re-estimate within-country growth slopes.

urls.resource_name: ECDC archived daily global COVID-19 cases/deaths (to 14 Dec 2020)
urls.why_needed: Original source used by the study during March 2020; enables reproduction of early-period analyses.
Provides GDP per capita used as a covariate in the cross-national regressions (match 2019 release or update for new replication).
Inequality covariate used as a control in the models.
Documentation to ensure correct series selection and interpretation for the Gini covariate.
Median age covariate at the country level as used in the original analysis; archive provides a stable snapshot.

urls.resource_name: Gelfand et al. (2011) Science paper record
urls.why_needed: Canonical source for the original 33-nation tightness–looseness index referenced by the study’s tightness measure.

urls.resource_name: GEM APS datasets portal (1998–2023+, incl. 2010 and later waves)
urls.why_needed: Primary entrepreneurship microdata used in the paper and required for replication with new years/waves.

urls.resource_name: GEM Manual: Design, Data and Quality Control (2017 update)
urls.why_needed: Defines GEM APS concepts and construction of entrepreneurship measures (e.g., early-stage, wage-paying), ensuring consistent variable replication.

urls.resource_name: U.S. Census Bureau International Database (IDB) landing
urls.why_needed: Official source for country age distributions to compute s_a, median age, and demographic parameter inputs.

urls.resource_name: IDB API documentation (single-year and 5-year age groups)
urls.why_needed: Programmatic access to age-by-year population shares needed to build s_a and median-age time series for replication.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI: Agriculture, forestry, and fishing, value added (% of GDP) (NV.AGR.TOTL.ZS)
urls.why_needed: Macroeconomic control used in robustness checks for country-year regressions.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI: Cost of business start-up procedures (% of GNI per capita) (IC.REG.COST.PC.ZS) metadata
urls.why_needed: Start-up cost control used in country-level specifications; metadata page anchors the indicator and download options.
Growth control variable for country-year regressions and five-year average growth construction.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI: Fertility rate, total (SP.DYN.TFRT.IN)
urls.why_needed: Demographic reference covariate cited by the paper when discussing demographic structure and robustness.

urls.resource_name: Barro-Lee Educational Attainment Dataset (1950–2015) official site
urls.why_needed: Source for tertiary education/attainment control used in the paper’s specifications.
Direct download location for the educational attainment series to build the education control.

urls.resource_name: International Property Rights Index – Previous Reports (incl. 2010 PDF)
urls.why_needed: Property rights index values (2010) used as a country institutional control; 2010 is held constant across years in the paper.

urls.resource_name: Wikipedia: Military service (country pages and summaries)
urls.why_needed: Used by the paper to code length/indicator for compulsory military service and the interaction term.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Flash Eurobarometer study overview – Entrepreneurship series
urls.why_needed: Gateway to FESE ‘Entrepreneurship’ datasets (2002, 2003, 2004, 2007, 2009, 2012) used for cross-dataset validation and for newer replication samples.

urls.resource_name: Flash Eurobarometer 283 (2009): Entrepreneurship in the EU and Beyond
urls.why_needed: One of the FESE entrepreneurship waves used to validate GEM results; provides microdata and docs via GESIS.
FESE entrepreneurship microdata for 2007 used in robustness/comparison to GEM.

urls.resource_name: Flash Eurobarometer 354 (2012): Entrepreneurship in the EU and Beyond
urls.why_needed: Later FESE entrepreneurship wave to extend the replication to a new period with comparable measures.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Flash Eurobarometer data access portal (incl. FE 559, 2025 Startups/Scaleups/Entrepreneurship)
urls.why_needed: Latest FESE entrepreneurship-related survey (2025) for a contemporary replication sample aligned to the paper’s design.

urls.resource_name: Penn World Table 7.1 via R pwt package (documentation and dataset)
urls.why_needed: Source for GDP per capita (PPP, 2005 base) and related macro controls as used in the original paper; ensures reproducible access to PWT 7.1.

urls.resource_name: NBER Working Paper version (Liang, Wang, Lazear, 2014/2016)
urls.why_needed: Contains methodological details and may include appendices; cited for the main claim and useful for aligning replication design.

urls.why_needed: Source for Polity IV/Polity5 democracy scores to classify ‘strong democracies’ (Polity ≥ 9) in replication.

urls.resource_name: Freedom in the World (historical ratings downloads)

Endogenous control in the ‘long’ specification.
Endogenous control in the ‘long’ specification (openness).

Demographic control (PROP65) in the ‘long’ specification.
Income inequality control used in robustness checks.

urls.why_needed: Institutional controls and party/legislature structure variables; also provides FEDERAL/MAJ/PRES indicators.

Ethnic/linguistic/religious fractionalization controls referenced in robustness checks.
Turnout variable used in interaction checks and mechanisms analyses.

urls.resource_name: OECD membership list with accession dates
urls.why_needed: For constructing the OECD membership dummy (pre-1993) used in controls.
Convenience code to fetch Polity and Freedom House series reproducibly for classification and robustness.

urls.why_needed: Provides an archived daily Citymapper Mobility Index (CMI) time series by city covering March 2020 needed to build the mobility outcome.
Backup scrape of CMI values for many cities in 2020–2021 to cross-check completeness of the DB.NOMICS archive.
R helper to programmatically download and parse Citymapper Mobility Index data for the specified cities and dates.
Global policy dataset with dated indicators such as workplace/business closures and stay-at-home orders to operationalize social distancing measures.
US state-level policy dates and intensities to assign intervention timing for US cities when replicating the analysis.
Event-level global NPI database with national and subnational (including some city/province) entries to refine city-specific policy timing.
Independent catalog of government social distancing and closure measures to validate or supplement policy timing and intensity.
Stable direct CSV/Parquet download endpoints for OxCGRT to streamline ingest in code pipelines.

urls.resource_name: PeerJ 2024 Supplemental S1 (first distancing dates by city)
urls.why_needed: City-level table of the first major physical distancing intervention date for the same Citymapper cities to proxy the policy-onset variable.

urls.resource_name: Soucy et al. 2024 Citymapper mobility code and data (Zenodo)
urls.why_needed: Open code repository with scripts and cleaned inputs for Citymapper-city analyses that can be adapted to re-estimate models with updated policy timing.
Alternative mobility data source (2020–2022) to replicate the design on a new dataset if CMI coverage is insufficient.
City-level mobility series (ended April 14, 2022) to replicate the analysis using a different provider and extended time window.
Consolidated CSVs of multiple mobility sources to facilitate constructing a new mobility series comparable to CMI.
Open-source code to fetch and merge Google/Apple/Waze mobility data for alternative replication runs.
R tools to pull, standardize, and analyze Apple and Google mobility data as a replacement mobility outcome for replication.
Hourly/daily city traffic indicators as a non–app-based mobility proxy to test robustness of the social distancing–mobility association.

Original wave used in the study; includes required trust and immigration measures.

Programmatic access to Manifesto Project data, enabling automated retrieval and processing of party-level variables.

Independent classification to identify far-right parties and construct national vote share for the moderator variable.
Direct dataset/codebook download for far-right/populist party classifications for linkage with election results.
Policy index used in robustness checks; provides pointers to data access for replication or extension.
Documentation of sampling, weights, and clustering needed to correctly estimate multilevel models with survey design.

Matches the paper’s stated precipitation source interface (IndexMundi/World Bank).

urls.resource_name: World Bank Climate Change Knowledge Portal (CCKP) – download
urls.why_needed: Historical country-level annual mean temperature to proxy the 'yearly average temperature' variable.

urls.resource_name: Average yearly temperature by country (World Bank-derived)
urls.why_needed: Convenient table of country-level average temperatures derived from World Bank/CRU for quick construction of the temperature regressor.
Source used by the paper (via Wikipedia) for Democracy Index 2019 and later years for replication on new samples.
Official EIU landing for recent Democracy Index results and methodology to obtain updated democracy scores.
Public alternative democracy measures (e.g., Liberal Democracy Index) for robustness/replication with a different index.
Alternative democracy measure (Polity scores) for replication and robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: Our World in Data COVID-19 data ETL repository
urls.why_needed: Code that builds the OWID COVID-19 dataset (including cases per million), supporting transparent data construction for replication.

urls.why_needed: Provides repeated cross-sectional microdata with worry/risk-perception items and gender to replicate the gender–worry claim on a new, nationally representative German sample.
Contains original questionnaires and item wordings to align measurement of 'worry about COVID-19' and recode response options comparable to the original study.
Reusable R code template (with dummy data) for cleaning, calculating proportions, and producing gender splits needed for the replication tests.
Open R/Shiny code that demonstrates variable handling and subgroup comparisons (e.g., by gender) which can be adapted for replication analysis.
Links to the coronavirus special survey and subsequent waves’ questionnaires and documentation to identify worry items and sample design.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Panel Special Survey on the Coronavirus SARS‑CoV‑2 Outbreak in Germany (PUF)
urls.why_needed: Public-use microdata from March 2020 including attitudes and risk-perception items with gender for an early-pandemic replication sample.

urls.resource_name: GESIS Panel Standard Edition landing page (ZA5665)
urls.why_needed: Cumulative scientific-use files across waves (including COVID-19 modules) with helper merge scripts to construct gender and worry variables over time.
High-frequency probability-based panel data from March–July 2020 with anxiety/worry items and gender for an additional independent replication sample.

urls.resource_name: German Internet Panel/Mannheim Corona Study data access instructions
urls.why_needed: Explains access steps and DOI references needed to obtain the MCS scientific-use file for replication.

urls.resource_name: WHO COSMO standard protocol and questionnaire template (PsychArchives)
urls.why_needed: Provides standardized instrument wording and response scales to match the operationalization of worry items when aligning across datasets.

urls.why_needed: Register and download IFLS4 (2007–08) and IFLS5 (2014–15) public-use data needed to build the hypertensive/undiagnosed, education, general health status, time/risk preference, distance to facility, and PCE variables for reproduction and a new-wave replication.
Central repository with links to study design, wave menus, and documentation pointers used when aligning measurements and modules across waves.

urls.resource_name: IFLS Data Updates, Notes, Tips, and FAQs (RAND)
urls.why_needed: Details wave-specific updates and clarifications (e.g., IFLS5 questionnaires in PDF, weights, biomarker notes, SAR facility counts) necessary for constructing consistent variables and understanding changes between IFLS4 and IFLS5.
Stable landing page to download IFLS4 user guides, questionnaires, and technical docs referenced while replicating measurement definitions.
Defines file structure, identifiers, weights, and module-specific notes used to merge books and construct the under-diagnosis and covariate variables.
Question text and skip patterns for self-rated general health, prior diagnosis of hypertension, education (years), and risk/time preference items used to match operationalization.
Technical documentation for household modules including consumption/expenditures used to construct per-capita expenditure (PCE).
Community/facility documentation used to identify and interpret distance-to-health-center and facility access measures.
Authoritative catalog entry confirming IFLS5 coverage and content for the new-wave replication, including biomarker collection and modules.
Closest national alternative with measured blood pressure, diagnosis, education, and health indicators to draw an independent Indonesian sample if IFLS5 is insufficient or for robustness checks.

urls.resource_name: IFLS wrangling and PCE construction example (R)
urls.why_needed: Reusable scripts illustrating how to generate total and per-capita household expenditures from IFLS5 modules, aiding replication of the PCE control.

urls.resource_name: Example Stata do-file working with IFLS books
urls.why_needed: Shows practical patterns for loading/merging IFLS book files (helpful template for building the analysis dataset with biomarker and questionnaire modules).

missing.resource_name: Original analysis code (probit models, sample construction, variable definitions) for Kim & Radoias (2016)
missing.search_query: Kim Radoias 2016 Social Science & Medicine replication code IFLS GitHub OSF data "Education, individual time preferences, and asymptomatic disease detection"

missing.resource_name: Direct public links to IFLS5 User’s Guides and Questionnaires (PDFs)

urls.why_needed: Official landing page to download GSS cumulative and single-year data and access alternate archives (SDA, Roper, ICPSR) for 2006/2008/2010 and later waves needed for replication and new samples.
Direct download page for GSS 1972–2024 cumulative file and merged single-year files including 2008 and 2010, matching the original and enabling updated replications.
Alternative format for obtaining the same GSS cumulative and single-year files used to construct variables and samples.
Alternative SAS-format access to cumulative and single-year GSS data to ensure format flexibility during replication.
Comprehensive codebook to verify question wording, response codes, years fielded, and missing-value conventions for all variables used to define latent classes and outcomes.
Documentation for the evolution item needed to code the dependent variable 'humans evolved from other animals' across years including 2006–2018.
Alternate official archive for downloading the GSS cumulative file and study-level datasets if institutional access preferences require Roper.
Stable DOI-archived cumulative dataset option for obtaining historical and 2006–2010 waves referenced in the original study.
Official codebooks and release notes needed to align measurement, weights, and design features across years when constructing replication datasets.
Questionnaire PDFs to confirm exact wording and ballot placement for science, evolution, and religion items used as class indicators.
Official crosswalk needed to construct the 5-class Erikson-Goldthorpe-Portocarero (EGP) occupational class variable used as a control.
NORC-provided Stata code to generate EGP classes from GSS occupational codes as implemented in the paper’s controls.
Authoritative SAS/SPSS/Stata syntax to construct religious tradition categories (e.g., conservative Protestant) used as predictors and controls.

urls.resource_name: Mplus Web Note 14 (TECH11/TECH14 for class enumeration)
urls.why_needed: Guidance and syntax options for LCA class-number testing (LMR/BLRT) matching the original model selection approach.
Working Mplus syntax for latent class analysis including TECH11/TECH14 and saving class probabilities to reproduce/replicate class assignment.
Template Mplus code for binary-indicator LCA closely matching the paper’s indicator structure (true/false and ordinal items).
Open-source LCA implementation to replicate classes on new GSS waves without Mplus; includes manual and examples.
Function documentation for specifying and estimating LCA models and exporting posterior class membership for downstream regressions.
R tooling to load GSS cumulative data and variable documentation efficiently and reproducibly when building replication datasets.
Repository to install/update code that streamlines downloading GSS single-year files and working with variables for replication.

missing.search_query: GSS BIGBANG variable codebook site:sda.berkeley.edu OR site:gss.norc.org

urls.resource_name: EPA State Energy CO2 Emissions (2017 snapshot)
urls.why_needed: Original study’s dependent variable; archived EPA state CO2 emissions (1990–2014) used for 2007–2013 panel.

urls.resource_name: EPA State CO2 Emissions from Fossil Fuel Combustion (updated series)
urls.why_needed: Successor tables (through ~2018) if replicating with slightly extended historical series consistent with EPA methodology.

urls.resource_name: EIA State Energy Data System (SEDS) portal
urls.why_needed: Closest official replacement to build a new replication sample; provides state CO2 from energy consumption, energy production, and related indicators annually.

urls.resource_name: EIA SEDS Data Files (CO2, Production, Consumption, Indicators)
urls.why_needed: Download-ready CSV/XLSX including ‘All CO2 emissions estimates’ and ‘Production’ series needed for emissions and energy production controls (1960–2024).

urls.resource_name: BLS CES State and Metro Area (SAE) homepage
urls.why_needed: Source for average weekly hours (all employees, total private) by state to construct the key working hours regressor.
Instructions to pull state-level ‘Average weekly hours of all employees’ series (select state→Total Private→Average weekly hours; annualize for 2007–present).

urls.resource_name: BLS CES State & Area Flat Files (SM dataset)
urls.why_needed: Bulk download of statewide CES series, including average weekly hours (data_type 2) for Total Private needed to compute annual averages.
Employment-to-population ratio at the state level used in the scale decomposition and as a control.

urls.resource_name: BLS State Employment–Population Ratio (annual averages) – Table 2
urls.why_needed: Direct table of state employment-population ratios to match/control across years when constructing scale variables.
Labor productivity (output per hour) at the state level used in scale models alongside hours and employment-to-population.
GDP levels needed to compute GDP per capita (composition model) and to derive manufacturing share of state GDP.
Pull annual GDP by state and GDP by industry (NAICS 31-33) to compute manufacturing share of GDP and obtain chained-dollar series.
Industry value added by state (Manufacturing NAICS 31-33) for manufacturing share control.
State total population for 2007–2010 portion of the panel to compute logged total population and per-capita measures.
State total population for 2011–2013 (and later years if extending the panel).
If extending replication beyond 2019, provides most recent state totals for per-capita scaling and controls.
Source for ACS 1-year state-level controls: average household size and working-age population share derived from subject tables.

urls.resource_name: ACS API – S1101 Households and Families (Average household size)
urls.why_needed: API/metadata to pull average household size by state for control variables in models.

urls.resource_name: ACS API – S0101 Age and Sex (working-age shares)
urls.why_needed: API/metadata to derive 15–64 (approx. via bins) or use 18–64 proxy; needed for working-age population share control.

urls.resource_name: League of Conservation Voters – National Environmental Scorecard Archive
urls.why_needed: Primary source for environmentalism measure; download congressional scorecards (1990–2005+) to compute state House/Senate averages.

urls.resource_name: LCV Members of Congress listings (exportable scores)
urls.why_needed: Interface with CSV export to harvest per-member annual scores for aggregation to state-level environmentalism index.
To recreate Census region dummies (Midwest, South, West; Northeast as reference) used in the study.

urls.resource_name: AEA Data and Code Repository (openICPSR) – Cohen, Dupas, Schaner AER 2015 replication package
urls.why_needed: Contains the authors’ replication code and packaged data to reproduce all tables/figures, including the 0.187 Any ACT subsidy coefficient.

urls.resource_name: Harvard Dataverse – AER Dataset for Cohen, Dupas, Schaner (Kenya ACT/RDT RCT)
urls.why_needed: Original RCT datasets (endline household survey, drug shop administrative/voucher data, symptoms database) required to construct ACT access/targeting outcomes.

urls.resource_name: DHS Program – Kenya Malaria Indicator Survey (KMIS) 2015 microdata
urls.why_needed: Provides nationally representative household illness/treatment variables (e.g., child fever care and ACT use) and RDT biomarkers to replicate the ACT take-up hypothesis with a new sample/time period.

urls.resource_name: DHS Program – Kenya Malaria Indicator Survey (KMIS) 2020 microdata
urls.why_needed: Later-wave MIS microdata to test external validity and replicate effects post-AMFm era with comparable measures of ACT treatment and malaria testing.
Outlet-level data on ACT availability, prices, and market share to proxy retail-sector subsidy intensity and link to household treatment behavior in replication analyses.
Additional ACTwatch outlet microdata for AMFm/CPM periods to measure variation in private-sector ACT access and prices for replication.
Complementary ACTwatch outlet microdata supporting construction of retail ACT price/availability indicators across settings and years.

Primary party-manifesto data with CMP category shares, party IDs, and vote/seat totals to build the economic/social dimensions via PCA, compute dispersion, and derive party counts/ENP on a new time period.

urls.resource_name: Manifesto Project datasets portal (incl. former versions, MPPI/MPPII)
urls.why_needed: Access to original-era releases (e.g., Mapping Policy Preferences I, 1945–1998) for reproducing the original sample and documentation/releases for consistent variable construction.
Variable definitions and CMP category descriptions needed to select the exact manifesto categories used for the economic and social policy dimensions.
Official coding scheme and category definitions to ensure consistent operationalization of CMP categories across time and countries.
Stata script for aggregating party-level CMP data to election-level indicators (e.g., polarization), which can be adapted to compute dispersion and lagged DV.
Programmatic access to the Manifesto Project main dataset and corpus, simplifying data retrieval, merging, and processing for PCA and dispersion construction.
Country–election level electoral-system data (e.g., SMD vs PR, district magnitude) to include electoral-rule controls consistent with the paper’s models for replication on new periods.
Alternative source for party vote/seat results by election to compute party counts and ENP or to cross-validate MPDS seat data.
Implements cluster-robust (sandwich) variance estimators needed to replicate robust SEs clustered by country.
Provides functions to compute the Laakso–Taagepera Effective Number of Parties (ENP) from vote or seat shares for the ENP-based analyses.

missing.resource_name: Original authors’ replication code (PCA category selection, dispersion construction, and party-count algorithm)
missing.search_query: British Journal of Political Science 2009 party dispersion number of parties manifesto replication code PCA CMP

urls.resource_name: OECD International Trade by Commodity Statistics (ITCS) – series landing
urls.why_needed: Primary source for import/export values by partner country and SITC Rev.3 sections 5–8 to construct 'Imports from the South' as % of GDP.

urls.resource_name: OECD ITCS 2005 Issue 1 (example volume, SITC Rev.3 by partner)
urls.why_needed: Provides country–partner trade in manufactured goods (SITC 5–8) for 1999–2004 consistent with the study period and methodology.

urls.resource_name: OECD ITCS 2005 Issue 4 (example volume, SITC Rev.3 by partner)
urls.why_needed: Additional OECD ITCS volume covering other sample countries/years needed to assemble complete panel of import flows.

urls.resource_name: UN Comtrade – Data Explorer (SITC Rev.3, partner-by-commodity) and API info
urls.why_needed: Closest contemporary source to build a NEW replication sample of SITC Rev.3 manufactured-goods imports from Southern partners beyond 2003 using the API.

urls.resource_name: UNSD – Standard International Trade Classification (SITC) Revision 3
urls.why_needed: Authoritative classification needed to verify that sections 5–8 correspond to manufactured goods when filtering imports.

urls.resource_name: OECD National Accounts of OECD Countries 2006, Vol. I: Main Aggregates
urls.why_needed: Original-source GDP aggregates and PPP-based comparative tables to construct national affluence (GDP per capita at PPP) for 1970–2003.
Provides nominal GDP series (current prices/US$) used as the denominator to scale imports as a percent of GDP for replication.

urls.resource_name: World Bank WDI – GDP per capita, PPP (constant international $) metadata (NY.GDP.PCAP.PP.KD)
urls.why_needed: Feasible alternative to build a NEW replication sample for national affluence with consistent PPP series if OECD PPP tables are unavailable.
Source for unemployment rates included as controls in the affluence equation when estimating the IMS→affluence association.

urls.resource_name: OECD Data Explorer API – access guide
urls.why_needed: Allows programmatic retrieval of OECD National Accounts and trade series to assemble the panel for replication.

urls.resource_name: Stata module xttest2 (Breusch–Pagan LM test for cross‑sectional dependence)
urls.why_needed: Implements the cross‑sectional dependence test used in the paper’s panel diagnostics before GLS estimation.

urls.resource_name: Stata module xttest3 (Modified Wald test for groupwise heteroskedasticity)
urls.why_needed: Implements the groupwise heteroskedasticity test used to justify GLS with heteroskedastic panels.

urls.resource_name: Stata FAQ (xtserial for Wooldridge test of AR(1) in panels)
urls.why_needed: Instructions and install source for the xtserial test used to diagnose serial correlation prior to specifying AR(1) in GLS.

urls.resource_name: Stata FAQ – specifying time variable in xtgls
urls.why_needed: Guidance for replicating the FE‑GLS setup with AR(1) and panel heteroskedasticity as in the original estimation.

urls.resource_name: Stata Base Reference Manual – reg3 (3SLS) documentation
urls.why_needed: Reference for estimating the FE‑3SLS robustness specification paralleling the paper’s simultaneous-equation checks.
Automates downloading SITC Rev.3 partner‑by‑commodity trade data to build 'Imports from the South' for a NEW sample.

urls.resource_name: R package comtradr – UN Comtrade API client
urls.why_needed: R tooling to fetch SITC Rev.3 trade flows programmatically for constructing IMS with updated years.
Implements 3SLS to replicate the robustness checks of the IMS→affluence relationship in R.

urls.resource_name: R package plm (panel estimators and tests)
urls.why_needed: Provides fixed‑effects and feasible GLS estimators and panel diagnostics if implementing the replication in R.

urls.resource_name: R nlme::gls (generalized least squares with AR(1)/heteroskedasticity)
urls.why_needed: Enables FE‑GLS‑style estimation with AR(1) correlation and heteroskedastic panels mirroring the study’s xtgls setup.
